alert.note: Alert for Daviess; Gibson; Knox; Pike (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 09 at 8:10PM EST until January 16 at 11:00AM EST by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Indiana... White River at Petersburg and at Hazleton. .Rainfall of 1.00 to 1.50 inches across southwestern Indiana this past Saturday night will maintain minor flooding on the White River from near Petersburg to the White River. Flooding is expected to continue through next weekend. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING THROUGH SUNDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...White River at Petersburg. * WHEN...Until late Sunday morning. * IMPACTS...At 19.0 feet, Low bottomlands flood and flooding begins on higher bottomlands. State Road 257 may begin to flood if Shoals gage reading is over 17 feet. Private levees may be overtopped in many cases. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:30 PM EST Sunday /6:30 PM CST Sunday/ the stage was 16.9 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 7:30 PM EST Sunday /6:30 PM CST Sunday/ was 16.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 19.6 feet early Tuesday afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage late Saturday evening. - Flood stage is 16.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/ind. The next statement should be issued by noon Monday.
